data.prayer: Spirit, give the disciples of the the state of San José de Ocoa words, actions, signs and wonders to proclaim the coming of the Kingdom.
data.verse: As you go, proclaim this message: "The kingdom of heaven has come near."

data.location_label: Photo from the state of San José de Ocoa, Dominican Republic
data.section_summary: What needs would people have here?

data.prayer: Father, your Word can be a lamp to the feet of the 51,763 people in the state of San José de Ocoa who claim to know you, if they open it and read it today.
data.verse: your Word is a lamp to my feet and a light to my path.

data.prayer: Father, be a refuge and strength for the hurting in San José de Ocoa, Dominican Republic today.
data.verse: God is our refuge and strength, an ever-present help in trouble.

data.prayer: Jesus, help the local leaders in San José de Ocoa, Dominican Republic not be proud but humble, and willing to wash the feet of all they serve.
data.verse: “You call me ‘Teacher’ and ‘Lord,’ and rightly so, for that is what I am. Now that I, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you also should wash one another’s feet. I have set you an example that you should do as I have done for you.

data.prayer: Father, I pray against the principalities, against the powers, against the world’s rulers of darkness of this age, and against the spiritual forces of the wickedness in the heavenly places that are warring against the Japanese people.
God in Heaven, only you can and should appoint evangelists. Please, appoint and send more to San José de Ocoa, Dominican Republic.
data.verse: And in the church God has appointed first of all apostles, second prophets, third teachers, then workers of miracles, and those with gifts of healing, helping, administration, and various tongues.

data.prayer: Father, move the 6,764 believers in the state of San José de Ocoa to say "Not our will, but yours be done", like Jesus.
data.verse: He withdrew about a stone’s throw beyond them, knelt down and prayed, "Father, if you are willing, take this cup from me; yet not my will, but yours be done."

data.focus_label: San José de Ocoa, Dominican Republic

data.prayer: Lord, for the leaders in the state of San José de Ocoa, let the eyes of their hearts be enlightened in order that they may know the hope to which they are called.
data.verse: I pray that the eyes of your heart may be enlightened in order that you may know the hope to which he has called you, the riches of his glorious inheritance in his holy people, and his incomparably great power for us who believe.

location.name: San José de Ocoa
location.full_name: San José de Ocoa, Dominican Republic
